abstract: Chicago officials say outside law firm will investigate past shootings by police officers with aim of restoring public confidence; city's police review board has been faulted for failing to punish officers for their roles in over 400 shootings, issue that has come to fore with white officers' shootings of black men; officials decline to say whether review will result in discipline.

headline.print_headline: New Look at Shootings by Police in Chicago
headline.main: Outside Panel to Examine Police Shootings in Chicago

snippet: Amid skepticism about an internal review board, which almost always sided with officers, a third party was chosen to look into past investigations.
lead_paragraph: Amid skepticism about an internal review board, which almost always sided with officers, a third party was chosen to look into past investigations.
